item.title: Annual Title I Survey
item.description:
We would like to know what you think about the Title I program services offered to your child. We would also like information about the parent involvement part of the program. Please take a few minutes to complete this survey. The responses will be used to improve the Title I program and be posted on our website for your review. 
(modified 1/24/2024)

item.title: New On-Site Healthcare Center
item.description:
Dear Parents, Guardians, and Staff, 

Harrison Central is excited to announce the opening of an on-site healthcare center at our facility! An advanced healthcare provider from WVU will be on-site to work along with our nurses to provide convenient care for Harrison Central students in a safe, child-friendly environment. This service will also be available for staff plus students beginning Wednesday March 2, 2022 and every other Wednesday from 7:30-11:30 am.

Click below to find out more about this new program.
(modified 2/28/2022)

item.title: Open Enrollment to begin March 1, 2021
item.description:
Parents from other school districts requesting enrollment in Harrison Hills School must submit an application to the Superintendent's Office between March 1-March 31, 2021. Parents/Guardians who are interested in the open enrollment program may complete the form at http://www.hhcsd.org/OpenEnrollment.aspx

Applications received prior to March 1, 2021 will not be accepted.

For questions or concerns please contact Kerri Johnson at kjohnson@hhcsd.org or 740-942-7803.

(modified 3/3/2021)

item.title: 2020 Reopening Plan
item.description:
Harrison Hills City School District’s Board of Education approved the Harrison Central start plan last evening. Student and staff safety are the key to this plan while still providing a sound educational environment. The plan is attached below:

2020 Reopening Plan Summary
2020 Reopening Plan Full 

Thank you to staff, parents, students, and community members for your continued support of Harrison Central. We can certainly get through these unique times together.

Update on Face Shields:

The federal Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) does not currently recommend the use of face shields as a substitute for masks/face coverings. That is because, at this time, it is not known what level of protection a face shield provides against the spray of respiratory droplets from the wearer to people nearby. There is currently not enough evidence to support the wearing of face shields to control the spray of respiratory droplets.

Ohio’s K-12 facial covering order requires facial coverings that cover the nose, mouth, and chin. There are limited exceptions to the order. If one of those exceptions applies to an individual, a face shield would be appropriate. Schoolwide use of face shields instead of masks is not appropriate and does not meet the requirements of the order.

(modified 8/17/2020)

item.title: Free School Supplies
item.description:
Free School Supplies Provided for All Students for the 2020-2021 School Year

The Harrison Hills City School District will provide all PK-12 students with his or her required school supplies to start the upcoming year. As always, Harrison Central students are not charged any fees for instructional materials.

As a welcome back gift, all students will be provided with their own Huskies water bottle for use throughout the school day. Additionally, all classrooms, lunchrooms and high traffic areas will be provided with hand sanitizer.

(modified 8/12/2020)

item.title: Public Service - Virtual Baccalaureate 2020
item.description: Please click here view the Virtual Baccalaureate service. (modified 6/9/2020)

item.title: Student Breakfast and Lunch Distribution
item.description:
Harrison Hills student school breakfast and lunch distribution will begin this Friday, March 20th. Then Monday, March 23rd and every Monday thereafter, we will distribute the meals for the entire week.
Pick up time will be 11:00-noon at grab and go locations:
  • Jewett Fire Hall
  • Scio Fire Hall
  • Hopedale Fire Hall
  • Freeport Fire Hall
  • Harrison Central (enter back lot from left side of school.) 

Pick-up procedures:

  • Cars will form a line
  • Do not exit your car
  • Give order for number of student bags needed

To prepare appropriate amounts of meals for the first pickup please call or email Kelly Howes: khowes@hhcsd.org or 740-942-7797 by Wednesday, March 18th. Provide students' names and your preferred pick-up location. Parents may continue to sign-up anytime for future grab and go student meals.

item.title: Huskies Talk Issue 20
item.description: (modified 2/25/2020)

item.title: Mobile Dentist
item.description:
Reminder to Parent/s

The Mobile Dentist will be at Harrison Central High School and Elementary on January 16th and 17th. Please send your application in to your child's teacher as soon as possible.  If you have any questions, please contact your school nurses at 740-942-7716 or 7616.

item.title: Huskies Talk Issue 14

item.title: Huskies Talk Issue 12
item.description: (modified 11/27/2019)

item.title: Time Capsules Located Behind Cornerstones
item.description:
November 15, 2019

On November 14, 2019, officials tasked with the abatement of the former Cadiz High School and original Harrison Central High School, located at 440 East Market Street in Cadiz, Ohio, located two time capsules behind the cornerstones of the building.  Both time capsules are similar in appearance, small copper boxes soldered closed to preserve the enclosed materials.

(modified 11/15/2019)
